node.title: SA's border is open. Here's who can come in and what rules are in place
node.alt: Logos for the EntryCheck SA and HealthCheck SA apps
node.description: At the stroke of midnight, South Australia's border opened. Here's a breakdown of who can enter the state and what rules are in place.
node.content:
["At the stroke of midnight, South Australia's border opened and, by yesterday afternoon, more than 29,000\u00a0applications to enter the state had been submitted.\u00a0", "Of those, more than 15,000 applications were from people assessed as coming from \"low-risk\"\u00a0and \"very low-risk\"\u00a0local government areas (LGAs) across Australia.", "
So, what is the process to enter?\u00a0
", "If you want to enter South Australia,\u00a0you will need to use the new EntryCheck SA website to find out the restrictions that apply to you\u00a0and to complete an application.", "To do so, the website will ask you to create a mySA GOV account, which will require you to provide personal information, including your date of birth, address and Medicare card details.", "", "
In order to use the EntryCheck SA website you will need to have a mySA GOV account.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "You will also need to upload evidence of your COVID-19 vaccination and provide the details of where you have spent most of your time while outside of the state.\u00a0\u00a0", "It will also ask for proof that you and your dependents have been fully vaccinated, with children under 12 years of age to be\u00a0treated as if they were\u00a0vaccinated.", "This proof can come through a certificate that can be connected from the Express Plus Medicare or federal myGov apps.", "You may also need an international vaccine certificate if you have been overseas.", "
How do I find out my LGA's risk level?\u00a0
", "You can find out the level of risk for interstate LGAs on the SA Health website.", "The risk level is assessed using the vaccination rates in each area and if they currently have community transmission.\u00a0", "According to SA Health, the information will be updated weekly, \"based on Australian Government vaccination data, and additional public health information, taking into account variations in data\".", "", "
SA Health has a table on its\u00a0website showing an assessment of the risk level in\u00a0interstate local government areas.\u00a0(SA Health)
", "
When should I submit my application?
", "You can complete the application up to\u00a014 days ahead of your planned travel to South Australia.", "SA Health recommends you have it completed at least 72 hours before you\u00a0plan to arrive in the state.", "", "
An example of a COVID-19 digital certificate accessible on the Express Plus Medicare app.(Supplied)
", "
What if I'm not vaccinated?
", "Unvaccinated people\u00a0wanting to travel to South Australia\u00a0can still apply using the EntryCheck SA website.\u00a0", "The SA Health website states:", "
What if EntryCheck SA website isn't working?
", "The EntryCheck SA website has had multiple outages since it was launched on Friday evening.\u00a0", "Yesterday,\u00a0South Australia's\u00a0Premier Steven Marshall apologised for the site being out of action for nearly an hour.\u00a0", "\"Apologies for that portal being down today but it is up and running now,\" Mr Marshall said.\u00a0", "\"The development of software like this would usually be a six- or a 12-month arrangement, especially one that was going to be under such a heavy use.\"", "", "
The EntryCheck SA website crumbled under\u00a0pressure when it was inundated with applications yesterday.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "Late yesterday, a\u00a0state government spokesperson said there had been a lot of traffic to the website.\u00a0", "\"Since launching, the platform has seen significant demand, and has been scaled-up to meet [that demand],\" the spokesperson\u00a0said.\u00a0", "\"Support teams are constantly monitoring the platform to ensure returning South Australians and travellers coming to our state are able to process their application smoothly.\"\u00a0", "
What if I'm just leaving the state\u00a0for the weekend?\u00a0
", "South Australian\u00a0residents who are vaccinated and only leaving the state for 72 hours or less are not required to test prior to their arrival back in South Australia.", "
I've submitted my application, what now?
", "Once the forms are completed, you will get an email telling you what your requirements are to enter South Australia.", "Depending on where you have been, you will be sent an email and text message with a link to download the HealthCheck SA app, but only on the day you are planning to enter South Australia.", "Below are the conditions of entry, according to risk level.\u00a0", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
